block.refabricated_necessities.feral_fla: Places invisible lights in a configurable radius automatically. A Feral Flare Torch can be bound to it, allowing manual placement of invisible lights. Whatever Feral Flare Torches you put down will be associated with the Feral Flare Lantern and will be destroyed upon the removal of the lamp itself.
item.refabricated_necessities.frozen_pea: Clears residual invisible lights in a 15 radius area. Typically you wouldn't need to use this unless something gets glitched out. When you remove a lantern it should remove all lights that were associated to it over time.
item.refabricated_necessities.feral_flar: Bind to a Feral Flare Lantern by right clicking it. After you're bound, you can place down invisible Feral Flare Torches which are associated with the lantern itself. Be careful though, since destroying the lantern will destroy all associated lights it has, including ones you've placed manually. Sneak + right click to clear lantern binding. Main use case is placing down a light in that pesky square that the lantern just refuses to place an invisible light in.
Bound lantern not found. Clearing binding.
No lantern bound. Right click a Feral Flare Lantern to bind.
Successfully bound lantern. You can now place feral flare torches bound to it. Sneak + right click to clear binding.
Object at previously bound coordinates is no longer a lantern. It was most likely removed. Clearing association.
Bound lantern has reached its light count limit.
item.refabricated_necessities.morph_tool: No items inside Morphing Tool. Craft with allowed item to add to tool. You can configure allowed items in the config file.
text.autoconfig.refabricated_necessities: Refabricated Necessities
Feral Flare Lantern
Feral Flare Lantern Tick Rate
How often the lantern attempts to place lights down. 1 means every tick, 10 means every 10 ticks.
Feral Flare Lantern Lights hard cap
Max amount of lights to spawn per lantern.
Feral Flare Lantern light radius
Radius to place lights in
Feral Flare Lantern minimum light level
Minimum light level to place an invisible light in
Morphing Tool
Morph in offhand instead of main hand?
Deny-list mods
Deny-list mods. Prevents attaching any items from specified mods to the Morphing tool.
Allow-list items
Allows specific items inside tool by ID. Use format modid:itemid
Allow-list names
Allows specific items inside tool based on their name.
Mod Aliases
Lets you associate specific mods to other related ones. E.g. Create Additions
might use the wrench from Create. Format modalias=mainmod
